name: Go Go Mongo!
tag_list: ahmed-siddiqui, mongo, startup-weekend-winner, startup-weekend, bay-area-startup-weekend, children-healthy-eating, educational-gaming, education-gaming, children-educational-gaming, healthy-eating-app, healthy-eating-app-children, healthy-eating-schools
overview:
Go Go Mongo!, which was originally launched at Startup Weekend 2010 as an English language game, is currently one of the leading kids healthy eating-focused brands in the mobile marketplace. The Go Go Mongo! team is a rag-tag team of artists, game developers and business guys obsessed with making fun games for kids. The company is driven by the vision of inspiring kids to reach for cauliflower and beyond.

About the Game: The Go Go Mongo! game encourages kids to teach Mongo, the happy-go-lucky somewhat distractible main character, how to make healthier eating choices. Currently available for the iOS platform in lite (FREE) and full ($.99) versions, the game consists of four fun, colorful landscapes and forty exciting levels filled with fruits, vegetables, dairy products, and meat products. Go Go Mongo! was designed with the idea that â€œkeeping it simpleâ€ is often a more effective learning environment for young children. The current version is appropriate for ages one to three years.
